intro: Diasperus fallax, commonly known as the false sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Diasperus fallax is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental appeal.
